page.title: 09THE NEW BY-PASS
page.content: On Friday 28th June 1985 plans were released in the local press of a solution to the problems of the A5 in the form of a spine road running parallel to the A5 from Wilnecote to Mile Oak. This idea was suggested 20 years ago but has been held up by a disagreement between the County Council and the Department of Transport as to who should be responsible for the bill. Local reaction to the scheme is generally mixed. Many people are pleased and feel that the spine road will help to solve many problems. Some are in favour of the idea but question the design of the road. One shopowner on the A5 was completely taken back when asked her views on the scheme-it was the first she had heard anything about it!
